subject: p16435402
History: With PMH lung nodules, presents w/ 6 wks hoarse voice, productive cough, reports desat at home. , R/o PNA/infection.
Findings: When compared to prior, there has been interval progression of the opacity in the left upper lobe. Hazy opacity in the left lung base corresponds with lingular atelectasis versus scarring and superimposed left lower lobe ground-glass seen on prior chest CT. Additional nodules previously described are not as clearly delineated by x-ray. The cardiomediastinal silhouette is within normal limits. No acute osseous abnormalities. Surgical clips in the right upper quadrant suggest prior cholecystectomy.
Impression: Left upper lobe consolidation has progressed since prior. This could be due to an infection however underlying malignancy cannot be excluded. Follow-up by chest CT is suggested and can be performed as previously recommended in .
